tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE AgriculturalData (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    soil_moisture FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE crop_data (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id UUID,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    soil_moisture FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE crop_analysis (
    analysis_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    crop_type TEXT,
    growth_stage TEXT,
    yield_estimation FLOAT,
    pest_status TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE SensorData (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    farmer_id INT,
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
    sensor_value FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (farmer_id) REFERENCES Farmers(farmer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE CropReports (
    report_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    farmer_id INT,
    crop_name VARCHAR(50),
    yield FLOAT,
    report_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (farmer_id) REFERENCES Farmers(farmer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Sensors (sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 sensor_type VARCHAR(255),
 location VARCHAR(255),
 installation_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE Data (data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 sensor_id INT,
 timestamp TIMESTAMP,
 temperature FLOAT,
 humidity FLOAT,
 FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES Sensors(sensor_id)
)

CREATE TABLE Crops (crop_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 crop_name VARCHAR(255),
 planting_date DATE,
 harvest_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE Yield (yield_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 crop_id INT,
 timestamp TIMESTAMP,
 weight FLOAT,
 FOREIGN KEY (crop_id) REFERENCES Crops(crop_id)
)

CREATE TABLE crop_data (
  data_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  crop_id INT REFERENCES crops(crop_id),
  field_id INT REFERENCES fields(field_id),
  measurement_id INT REFERENCES measurements(measurement_id),
  yield FLOAT
);
